<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.

<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_Console_CopyOut:
```c
static int32 OS_Console_CopyOut(OS_console_internal_record_t *console, const char *Str, size_t *NextWritePos)
{
    const char *pmsg;
    size_t      WriteOffset;
    int32       return_code;

    return_code = OS_ERROR;
    pmsg        = Str;
    WriteOffset = *NextWritePos;
    while (true)
    {
        if (*pmsg == 0)
        {
            /* String is complete */
            *NextWritePos = WriteOffset;
            return_code   = OS_SUCCESS;
            break;
        }
        console->BufBase[WriteOffset] = *pmsg;
        WriteOffset                   = WriteOffset + 1;
        if (WriteOffset >= console->BufSize)
        {
            WriteOffset = 0;
        }

        if (WriteOffset == console->ReadPos)
        {
            /* out of space */
            return_code = OS_QUEUE_FULL;
            break;
        }

        ++pmsg;
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: Only the while (true) controlling expression in the function is a compile-time invariant and therefore warrants investigation under MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3. All other controlling expressions in the function are data-dependent at runtime: the if conditions (if (*pmsg == 0), if (WriteOffset >= console->BufSize), if (WriteOffset == console->ReadPos)) depend on variables or memory contents and are not invariant. There is no do-while with a constant controlling expression, no for-loop with a constant bound, and no other constant controlling expressions present. Assignments and buffer accesses are not controlling expressions for the purposes of this rule.
